jsx.ui.vect
Class Graphic

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.vect.Graphic
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender, OnStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
Draw
public class Graphic
extends Widget
implements OnRender, OnStyle

A base class for widgets that wrap HTML vector graphics elements.

This class provides basic functionalities to manipulate the underlying vector graphics element, which is either a VML element for IE or a SVG element for other browsers, eliminating the browser dependencies.

A Graphic widget is Configurable and is also an event source which fires Widget.Event events.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
SVG, VML

Constructor Detail

Graphic

public Graphic()

The default constructor to create widgets of this type.

This constructor simply invokes the typical constructor of this class passing a newly created graphic component, which wraps a HTML <div> element, as argument.

Since:
1.0

Graphic

public Graphic(Component e)

A typical constructor that constructs widgets of this type and forces constructors of subclasses to pass a graphic component.

This constructor invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified graphic component as argument and registers the wrapper widget being constructed as an event listener to listen Render and Style events fired from the underlying graphic component.

Parameters:
e - The underlying graphic component which is a component that wraps an HTML <div> element that is containing either a VML element for IE or a SVG element for other browsers.
Since:
1.0

graphic

public static final Component graphic()

Creates and returns a root graphic component, eliminating the browser dependencies.

Returns:
The newly created root graphic component which is either a VML group component for IE or a SVG component wrapping an HTML <svg:svg> element for other browsers.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
SVG.svg(), VML.group()

curve

public static final Component curve(Graphic g,
                                    Motion m,
                                    int n)

Draws a curve specified by a motion on a graphic widget.

Parameters:
g - The current graphic wrapper.
m - The motion definition.
n - The number of steps used to draw the curve. The larger this number, the more precise the curve but the more time it takes to draw the curve.
Returns:
The path component of the curve which is either a VML shape component for IE or a SVG path component for other browsers.
Since:
1.0
